ENVIRONMENT
Our combined Scope 1 and 2 market-based 
emissions were 48,321 metric tons of CO2 
equivalent units (MTCO2e), 8% higher than 
in 2020. The increase was primarily due to 
the addition of more complete data from 
our SPTS and Orbotech division sites that 
was not available in prior years. 
Other factors included improved data 
detail, availability, and category revisions of 
leased properties, which resulted in a more 
accurate representation of energy use in 
those facilities. We also obtained more 
robust data on mobile emissions sources. 
As Scope 3 comprises the vast majority 
of our emissions, we continue to improve 
upon our data collection, analysis and 
estimation methodologies. Emissions 
resulting from business travel (Scope 
3) were 10,789 tons (MTCO2e) in 2021, 
compared with 11,548 tons in 2020. 
One reason for the decrease is because 
business travel was still very limited in 
2021, and the 2020 figure includes ‘pre-
pandemic’ travel in early 2020, which was 
at a much higher rate. Upstream transportation

(+work from home)The 2021 inventory includes expanded 
data from the SPTS division, as well as 
additional ground transportation sources 
such as train data which was not readily 
available the prior year. However even with 
the additional data sources for business 
travel, the pandemic has continued to 
affect corporate travel worldwide which 
also impacts GHG emissions. 
Employee commute emissions increased 
significantly due to employees returning to 
work sites and the inclusion of employee 
work-from-home emissions that were not 
estimated during 2020.
Due to these factors and other 
methodology changes, an accurate year-
on-year comparison is not applicable, 
so we have visually presented only 2021 
data in the charts shown here. We intend 
to present year-on-year performance 
in future reports. For more detailed 
information on our GHG Inventory, please 
see our 2022 CDP Climate Change report.KLA Scope 1 & 2 Market-Based
